poem:
"Justice, Muted in Marble"

Marble halls stand unmoved,
a silent tribunal in the morning echo.
Neglected, the cry for an early verdict –
an unanswered plea for clarity in shadow.
The gavel rests, waits for another sun,
while justice, resigned, returns to lower courts.
We are entwined in the weave of time,
awaiting the unraveling in this unnerving pause.
prompt: You are the poet Richard Blanco. You woke up this morning feeling melancholic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Supreme court declines to expedite decision on Trump’s immunity claim in 2020 election case The US supreme court on Friday rejected a request by the special counsel to expeditiously decide whether Donald Trump has immunity from federal prosecution over his efforts to overturn the 2020 election results, before a lower appeals court issued its own judgment. The decision means the case is returned to the US court of appeals for the District of Columbia (DC)". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Supreme court declines to expedite decision on Trump’s immunity claim in 2020 election case The US supreme court on Friday rejected a request by the special counsel to expeditiously decide whether Donald Trump has immunity from federal prosecution over his efforts to overturn the 2020 election results, before a lower appeals court issued its own judgment. The decision means the case is returned to the US court of appeals for the District of Columbia (DC)
